title: Break time
body:
I reckon I've landed on my rank. Been playing for ages and have climbed pretty quickly back to silver after a mystifying placements process. But I'm now at the point where I can't carry a team alone, and games are lost not on the faults of a potato but who has the better team fight.

This isn't a whinge.  in fact I am in some sense happy that I found this spot but it also means for me that climbing from here in yolo q requires more skill than I currently have and far more time than I am willing to invest.

Might pop back in to duo queue for shits and giggles but for the moment I have uninstalled and am going to dip into the backlog of games I accumulated while concentrating on lol.

Lol still the best game i have played in years and one into which I have sunk a load of cash because I am happy to support what riot does.

But for now, au revoir. I'll probably be back but looking to take a solid month or two off.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

replies.body: I reckon in Low elo skill not a important as Luck if you got a good team even feed  your ass off you still going to win but if you run in a bad team even you 1 v4ing people you still going to lose because your bad luck

There is a misconception that you can carry a game on your own. Whilst if you do well it impacts more favourably in your direction the outcome is purely based on a team level. After many games myself it has come to my attention that no matter how good you are if your team loses their lane the odds of winning are extremely low.

If you would like some advice I would recommend playing some games and finding 2 people who you have synergy with. With this I have now a 65% win ratio and climbed from Silver 4 to Silver 1 in a week. Of course there will be days where things aren't going your way and you lose more then you win but I'd take into consideration that some days you just don't play as well as others and to take a break.

Hope this helps!

Synergy is exactly the right word.

Duo with a few peeps and we deffo win more than we lose. In the new world premades are definitely king.
Sometimes a break is good as when you return you'll have a renewed view on things, and may find that the wall is no longer as high as you thought. :)
